revised_title: The Monoaminergic Innervation of the Rat Visual Cortex: A Study of Noradrenaline and Serotonin
tldr: This study examines the distribution of monoamines, noradrenaline and serotonin, in the visual cortex of the rat using high-pressure liquid chromatography (h.p.l.c.) and radioautography. The results show that the majority of monoaminergic axon-terminals form typical synaptic contacts with dendritic shafts or spines. The findings provide a thorough description of the extent and mode of termination of the monoaminergic system in the rat visual cortex.
